definition[0]: an amount of money paid to someone, especially a lawyer, so that they will continue to work for you in the future
definition[1]: a reduced amount of rent that you pay for a room, flat etc when you are not there, so that it will still be available when you return
definition[2]: a plastic and wire object that you wear in your mouth to make your teeth stay straight
definition[4]: money paid to someone such as a lawyer so that they will continue to work for you in the future
example[0]: Directors received £550 for each board meeting and an annual retainer of £10,000.
example[1]: Mr. Young ison retainer to (=receiving a retainer from) an international engineering firm.
